data.text:
@LiamButlerWA If you have reason to be extra cautious, and if you can do it, it's quite reasonable to take the kids out of school for the next 3-8 weeks.

WA has just reached NSW levels of transmission.  It will settle down again, but in the meantime there's lots of virus circulating.

@loosae @JBell100099 @LiamButlerWA Daughter's BF who was asymptomatic on holidays in Anglesea. Only the BF tested positive with 3 of us negative; however, my partner and I had mild cold symptoms within days.  Minor head cold and sore throat (not too bad) for 2 days and then back at it. Two 27 y.o. asymptomatic
@LiamButlerWA I think it’s high time everyone pulled their children out of school for a while to teach this government a lesson. Stuff your jobs and everything else, this is for the greater good.
@JBell100099 @LiamButlerWA Rubbish. I got Covid and tested negative on a PCR. You could not lockdown forever and believe you could have stopped omi.
@LiamButlerWA @julsc44 I noticed that today. Instead of acting to slow cases it's just about keeping people in work at any cost.
@LiamButlerWA Do you have kids of your own?

@plainte @JBell100099 @LiamButlerWA We’ve got 1,000s of kids being infected daily in Vic, NSW & now Qld, ACT, SA & Tas. It started in term 4 in Vic & NSW. It’s horrific. Crickets in the media. Covid is ripping thru Australian children. Which in turn infect their families. The cycle continues. 2nd infections soon.
@Rachael17116162 @LiamButlerWA 😂😂😂 Definitely couldn't be the vax, definitely covid. I'd say most peoples brains were shrunk before the vax.
@LiamButlerWA My kid is not going back to school anytime soon.
